Podcast Glossary Terms

Artwork :
Visual content associated with a podcast, often displayed alongside episode listings in podcast directories.

Chapter Markers :
Timestamps embedded in a podcast episode, allowing listeners to jump to specific sections or segments.

Download :
The process of saving a podcast episode file to a local device for offline listening.

Episode :
A single installment or edition of a podcast series, typically focused on a specific topic or theme.

Feed :
A web feed that provides updated podcast content to subscribers. Usually in RSS (Really Simple Syndication) format.

Hosting Provider :
A service that stores and delivers podcast media files to listeners. Commonly used to host podcast episodes and generate an RSS feed.

ID3 Tags :
Metadata embedded in audio files, providing information such as episode title, artist, album, and cover art.

Libsyn :
Short for Liberated Syndication, Libsyn is a popular podcast hosting service that provides media hosting and distribution.

Listener Feedback :
Comments, questions, or reviews submitted by listeners, fostering engagement with the audience.

MP3 :
A common audio file format widely used for podcast episodes due to its compression and compatibility.

Monetization :
The process of earning revenue from a podcast through methods such as advertising, sponsorships, and listener donations.

Niche :
A specialized segment or topic within the broader category of podcasts. Podcasts often cater to specific niches to target a particular audience.

Podcast :
A digital audio or video file or series of files that can be streamed or downloaded from the internet.

Podcatcher :
A software application or device used to subscribe to, download, and manage podcasts. Also referred to as a podcast client or aggregator.

Q&A :
Question and Answer format, where hosts answer questions submitted by listeners or audience members.

RSS Feed :
Really Simple Syndication format used to publish frequently updated content, allowing users to subscribe to podcasts.

Scripted Podcast :
A podcast episode with a planned and written script, often involving a narrative or storytelling format.

Show Notes :
Information, links, or additional context provided by podcast creators in the episode description.

Sponsorship :
A form of advertising where companies pay to have their products or services promoted during a podcast episode.

Streaming :
Listening to a podcast episode in real-time without downloading the file, requiring an internet connection.

Transcript :
A written version of the spoken content in a podcast episode. Transcripts can be provided to make content more accessible and searchable.

Vlogcast :
A hybrid form of content that combines elements of video blogging (vlogging) and podcasting. Typically includes both audio and video components.
